conclusion: The problem involves a small ball with mass \\( m \\), charge \\( q \\), and is suspended by an insulating string with a length \\( L \\). The ball is at rest under the influence of a uniform electric field.
The forces acting on the ball include gravitational force, tension in the string, and electric force.
The ball is at rest, so the net force in both the vertical and horizontal directions must be zero.
The vertical equilibrium condition gives \\( T \cos \theta = mg \\).
The horizontal equilibrium condition gives \\( T \sin \theta = qE \\).
Substituting \\( T \\) into the horizontal equilibrium equation gives \\( \frac{mg}{\cos \theta} \sin \theta = qE \\).
Simplifying the equation results in \\( mg \tan \theta = qE \\).
The electric field strength \\( E \\) is \\( \frac{mg \tan \theta}{q} \\).
